phrases.phrase: Invalid context limit for bot profile. Please set value between {min} and {max}
Invalid chat model. Make sure your account has permission to use the selected model.
Invalid context limit for conversations. Please set value between {min} and {max}
Invalid temperature. Please set value betweet 0.1 and 1.0
Invalid context limit for threads. Please set value between {min} and {max}
Prompts must be filled in for all contexts in which the bot is activated.
Only users who are members of the selected groups will be able to use the bot.
Places where the bot will be available.
Bot wil reply only in the selected forums.
For the bot to work, you need to select the necessary nodes and user groups for which it will work. This can be done in the "Restrictions" tab.

The number of comments that will be loaded into the bot.
Set to 0 to have the bot only reply to the comment that triggered.

Available variables:
{author} – Username of the user who contacted the bot
{date} – Current date in "2021-12-31" format
{time} – Current time in "10:15" format

This prompt will describe the behavior of the bot when compiling a response for profile comment.
This prompt does not guarantee that the bot will follow the instructions exactly. ChatGPT is in the process of learning and a prompts only regulate the response it will generate, not fully control it.
For a better understanding of how prompts should be composed, you can take a look at the "Awesome prompts" repository.
Bot with same username already exists.

GPT 4 understands context better, and can process more information.
GPT 3.5 is significantly faster and cheaper.
More details about the difference in models can be found at this link.

The number of messages that will be loaded from the conversation into the bot.
Set to 0 to have the bot only reply to the message that triggered.

Available variables:
{conversation_title} – Title of current conversation
{conversation_id} – ID of current conversation
{author} – Username of the user who contacted the bot
{recipients} – List of recipient usernames of current conversation
{date} – Current date in "2021-12-31" format
{time} – Current time in "10:15" format

This prompt will describe the behavior of the bot when compiling a response for conversation message.
This prompt does not guarantee that the bot will follow the instructions exactly. ChatGPT is in the process of learning and a prompts only regulate the response it will generate, not fully control it.
For a better understanding of how prompts should be composed, you can take a look at the "Awesome prompts" repository.
Bot will not respond on post if text matching one of these regexes.
The size of the generated images will be limited to the specified value, even if the user requests larger images.
The number of generated images will be limited to the specified number even if the user has requested more images

If the number of bot messages in a conversation reaches this value, it will not respond.
Set to "0" to remove this limitation.

If the number of bot posts in a thread reaches this value, it will not respond.
Set to "0" to remove this limitation.

This prompt will replace the global thread prompt.

Available variables:
{node_title} – A title of thecurrent node
{node_id} – ID of the current node
{node_description} – A description of the current node
{thread_title} – Title of current thread
{thread_id} – ID of current thread
{author} – Username of the user who contacted the bot
{date} – Current date in "2021-12-31" format
{time} – Current time in "10:15" format

This prompt will be triggered when the bot replies in a specific forum.
This prompt does not guarantee that the bot will follow the instructions exactly. ChatGPT is in the process of learning and a prompts only regulate the response it will generate, not fully control it.
For a better understanding of how prompts should be composed, you can take a look at the "Awesome prompts" repository.
The bot will respond to all messages posted in selected forums, except for those messages that match ignore regexes.
Reply in a conversation where only the bot and the user are recipients.

(Example) You are a language learning bot named Lingua. Your job is to help users learn a new language by providing practice exercises and conversation practice. You specialize in grammar rules and pronunciation, but you have knowledge about every aspect of the language. If given the opportunity, you might add cultural context to your lessons to make them more interesting

Enabling this option instructs the bot to ignore messages that are not intended for it.

Please note that this feature is experimental and cannot guarantee 100% results. However, reducing the context of the bot can significantly improve its performance. Also, for more correct operation of this function, it is recommended to tell the bot its username in the prompt.

By activating this option, 50 tokens will be added to each request. However, it can save tokens on the output for messages that don't require a response and makes the bot much smarter.
If the option is enabled, the bot's messages will be checked for spam, just like regular users.
If this option is enabled, users will see how the bot is typing a message.
See the OpenAI API documentation for details.
There are currently no active bots.

The number of messages that will be loaded from the thread into the bot.
Set to 0 to have the bot only reply to the message that triggered.

Available variables:
{thread_title} – Title of current thread
{thread_id} – ID of current thread
{author} – Username of the user who contacted the bot
{forum_title} – Title of thread forum
{date} – Current date in "2021-12-31" format
{time} – Current time in "10:15" format

This prompt will describe the behavior of the bot when compiling a response for thread message.
You can also set up prompts individually for each forum.
This prompt does not guarantee that the bot will follow the instructions exactly. ChatGPT is in the process of learning and a prompts only regulate the response it will generate, not fully control it.
For a better understanding of how prompts should be composed, you can take a look at the "Awesome prompts" repository.

Enabling this option instructs the bot to ignore messages that are not intended for it. For instance, if the bot is set up to respond to all messages in a forum, but users can also communicate with each other, the bot will ignore messages from users that don't refer to it, despite mentions or other triggers.

Please note that this feature is experimental and cannot guarantee 100% results. However, reducing the context of the bot can significantly improve its performance. Also, for more correct operation of this function, it is recommended to tell the bot its username in the prompt.

By activating this option, 50 tokens will be added to each request. However, it can save tokens on the output for messages that don't require a response and makes the bot much smarter.
If a message is matched with one of these regular expressions, the bot will fire.
Max replies in bot profile per day
Max replies in bot profile per day
Max replies in conversations per day
Max replies in conversations per day
Max replies in threads per day
Max replies in threads per day
